title: Information Systems (B.Sc.) | WiSo Faculty
content:
Fundamentals for Innovations in Products, Processes and Business Models

320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxIf you are already pursuing a B.Sc. in Information Systems and would like to find out about the specific details of your bachelor's degree programme, you will find information on the“programme structure"page.Table of contentsKey FactsWhy this programme stands outWho should apply?Programme overviewAcademic excellence meets international scopeCareer opportunitiesApplication informationDetailed information and contactChat with PacoChat with a studentKey Facts320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxDegree:Bachelor of ScienceDuration:6 semestersCredits:180 ECTSLanguages:German, EnglishBeginning:Winter semesterContent:Interdisciplinary discipline of business administration, economics and computer science, which deals with the conception, development and application of information systems in business, administration, and in our private lives.International:Studies abroad, summer school, Business English course (optional)Why this programme stands out:Comprehensive fundamentals and individual specialisation:A business information systems degree of theCologne Institute for Information Systems (CIIS)consists of a comprehensive basic training in the relevant disciplines of economics, computer science and business information systems. Throughout your studies, you will benefit from the exchange between and connecting of the various disciplines and departments within the WiSo Faculty and the University of Cologne.Intensive supervision in small groups:We promote interpersonal exchange by organising small group work. Goal-oriented work in parallel small groups is not only offered in core courses in advanced semesters but also; in specific courses in the basic and advanced modules.Strong practical relevance:Application-oriented project events such as the "Capstone Project" are an integral part of the curriculum and are formatted, in cooperation with companies and organisations. They expose you to the practical relevance of course material and enable you to apply the concepts and methods of digitalisation taught to solve practical problems.To top of pageChat with Paco320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxPaco - your AI for Studies at the WiSo Faculty of the University of Cologne, will answer all your fact-based questions about your desired degree programme at any time! - looking for quick information on degree programmes, admission procedures or general questions about the University of Cologne?Then Paco is just right for you!*Who should apply?You should have the following professional, methodical and personal strengths and inclinations for the successful completion of a bachelor's degree:interest in technical and mathematical issuesabstract and conceptual thinking skillsexcellent analytical skillsgood German and English language skillsindependent, goal- and result-oriented way of workingmotivation and the ability to work in a teamBy taking the onlinemath test in ILIAS, prospective students can compare their knowledge and skills with the requirements of most of the degree programmes at the WiSo Faculty (only in German).Chat with a student320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxDo you want first-hand insights and experiences about the Bachelor Information Systems and the Student life at the University of Cologne from WiSo students?Then don't hesitate and Chat with a student!I chose information systems because the theory-based and practice-oriented degree programme offers me excellent career prospects at the interface between business administration and technology in the course of digitalisation.To top of pageProgramme overview320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxWhat is "Information Systems"?As an application-oriented subject, information systems has its own methods and tools and draws on the disciplines of economics and computer science. Other important auxiliary disciplines are mathematics and statistics. Thus, research and teaching content from the listed disciplines is taught during the degree programme.The study programme provides an overview of the design possibilities using information technology (IT) and conveys an understanding of possible areas of application in the context of companies or in everyday life. The focus is on the design and development of information and application systems to support processes and activities within and between organisations and households.Possible questionsThe B.Sc. in Information Systems programme prepares students to solve the following and other questions:How can IT projects be carried out efficiently and successfully?How are requirements for software products defined correctly and completely?How is software implemented, tested and rolled out as economically and effectively as possible?How are companies/business processes supported with the help of information systems?What role do information systems play in the operations of companies?What structures and system approaches exist in the area of IT systems?How are processes and procedures correctly modelled within a company / IT system?How can decision-making processes be supported with the help of data and IT?Optimal preparation for future challengesThe aim of the programme is to enable you as a graduate to support people and organisations in carrying out and fulfilling a wide range of applications using IT. This includes both the research and professional world as well as private everyday life.The Bachelor's programme in Information Systems at the renowned WiSo Faculty and the Cologne Institute for Information Systems offers a broad basic education in the interplay of theory and practice at the interface of economics and computer science. You will be given the opportunity to put analytical structuring, thinking and acting into practice in research and application-oriented manner by using the knowledge and skills you have acquired to solve practical problems.To top of page320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxStill undecided?Then get to know ouroffers for prospective students, which are coordinated by the WiSo Student Service Point and will provide you with individual advice tailored precisely to your needs.Orientation and counselling services for prospective studentsAcademic excellence meets international scope320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxInternational orientation throughout the entire course of studyWe receive applications from a large number of different nationalities for the majority of our degree programmes, so a large international and intercultural environment exists both at the faculty and within your degree programme. A large number of courses are therefore offered in English, depending on the specialisation.Optional semester abroadThe WiSo Faculty is a member of several networks of international universities, which assists you in spending a semester abroad at a renowned partner university. The programme is designed so that you can spend a semester abroad in your fourth or fifth semester.We are happy to adviseyou on your options and provide you with organisational support before, during and after your exchange.An opportunity for global networkingWith its balanced theoretical and practical approach, the degree programme prepares you for entry into internationally oriented professions and enables you to work in an international environment. Additionally, the WiSo Faculty has a broad alumni network of former students who work in all business sectors around the globe.An international FacultyThe international focus and outstanding reputation of the WiSo Faculty at the University of Cologne make it a premier destination for your studies in Germany – at the heart of Europe.Calendar of Events for International StudentsInterested in a German course? Subject-specific and skills-based Language CoursesQuestions about visas, certificates, or jobs? The International Office is here to help!To top of pageCareer opportunities320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxB.Sc. Information Systems graduates possess the dual qualification of business management and computer science that is often sought after in the job market. As a graduate, you are eligible for employment in various sectors (e.g., business consulting, systems development management, and information management) and internal departments. You will function as an intermediary between business processes and the technically-anchored system world.Successful completion of the degree programme offers you a springboard into the attractive (IT) job market through our existing wide-ranging network of top industry and business professionals. As a result, you will work in a variety of different roles across all sectors. The versatility of the possible degree applications can be seen in the potential job offerings, such as:IT Manager / IT Project ManagerFounder / IT-Startup FounderManagement Consultant with a focus on "strategy consulting" or "IT consulting"Business AnalystProduct Manager in technology companiesData Scientist / Data AnalystSoftware Architect / Software DeveloperProcess Manager in social research marketsApply for a master's degree after your bachelor's degree!With a good Bachelor's degree and an appropriate focus, the programme also prepares you for further academic education and a scientific career. Potential areas of further study are theM.Sc. Information Systemsas well as theM.Sc. Business Analytics and Econometricsat the University of Cologne or similar programmes in business informatics, information systems, business analytics or data science at other universities.To top of pageWorldwide alumni career networkBy enrolling in the degree programme, you become part of a large network of current and former students, our alumni. This gives you exclusive access to the practical and business world during and after your studies. Multiple event series and special coaching programmes put you in contact with companies and other potential employers.So that you can get an idea of student life at the WiSo Faculty,WiSo alumnifrom business, science and society report on their experiences during their studies as well as their professional careers and challenges.Through my studies, I gained a broad insight into the field of information systems, expanded my professional and personal network and even got to know my co-founders.To top of pageApplication informationWe are looking forward to your application!Application deadlines for online applicationThe application deadline for thefirst semesteris usually:15 July for the start of studies in winter semesterApplicants from Germany and EU countries apply online via the website of theStudent’s Registration Office.Applicants fromnon-EU countriesapply viauni-assist.RequirementsApplicants from Germany and EU countriesUniversity entrance qualificationGerman-language proficiency at level DSH-2 or equivalentEnglish language skills B2 (CEFR) are required. These can be proven by:University entrance qualification from Germany, EU or EEA countries: After the end of class 11 (G8) or class 12 (G9) at least 5 points in German grading system must be demonstrated (applies to German school leaving certificates).University entrance qualification or higher education degree (e.g. bachelor's degree) totally taught in EnglishTOEFL, Internet-based Test (iBT): 72IELTS-Test: 5.5Cambridge: B2 First, BEC Vantage, C1 Advanced (CAE), C2 Proficiency (CPE)telc-Zertifikat: B2TOEIC with the following minimum scores: 400 (listening), 385 (reading), 150 (writing), 160 (speaking)Applicants from non-EU countriesUniversity entrance qualification (directorindirect)German-language proficiency at level DSH-2 or equivalentTestAS certificate (subject specific module in Economics/Management, minimum score 90)English language skills B2 (CEFR) are required. These can be proven i.a. byUniversity entrance qualification or higher education degree (e.g. bachelor's degree) totally taught in EnglishTOEFL, Internet-based Test (iBT): 72IELTS-Test: 5.5Cambridge: B2 First, BEC Vantage, C1 Advanced (CAE), C2 Proficiency (CPE)telc-Zertifikat: B2TOEIC with the following minimum scores: 400 (listening), 385 (reading), 150 (writing), 160 (speaking).Detailed information and contactWe are happy to support you in your ambitions:If you are interested in or have questions about our WiSo degree programmes, the student advisors at theWiSo Student Service Pointwill be happy to help:WiSo Student Service Point hotline: +49 (0) 221/470-8818www.wiso-studentservice.uni-koeln.deTo top of pageHIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum ChatTo top of page

If you are already pursuing a B.Sc. in Information Systems and would like to find out about the specific details of your bachelor's degree programme, you will find information on the“programme structure"page.

To top of page

Paco - your AI for Studies at the WiSo Faculty of the University of Cologne, will answer all your fact-based questions about your desired degree programme at any time! - looking for quick information on degree programmes, admission procedures or general questions about the University of Cologne?Then Paco is just right for you!*

You should have the following professional, methodical and personal strengths and inclinations for the successful completion of a bachelor's degree:

By taking the onlinemath test in ILIAS, prospective students can compare their knowledge and skills with the requirements of most of the degree programmes at the WiSo Faculty (only in German).

Do you want first-hand insights and experiences about the Bachelor Information Systems and the Student life at the University of Cologne from WiSo students?Then don't hesitate and Chat with a student!

I chose information systems because the theory-based and practice-oriented degree programme offers me excellent career prospects at the interface between business administration and technology in the course of digitalisation.

To top of page

As an application-oriented subject, information systems has its own methods and tools and draws on the disciplines of economics and computer science. Other important auxiliary disciplines are mathematics and statistics. Thus, research and teaching content from the listed disciplines is taught during the degree programme.

The study programme provides an overview of the design possibilities using information technology (IT) and conveys an understanding of possible areas of application in the context of companies or in everyday life. The focus is on the design and development of information and application systems to support processes and activities within and between organisations and households.

The B.Sc. in Information Systems programme prepares students to solve the following and other questions:

The aim of the programme is to enable you as a graduate to support people and organisations in carrying out and fulfilling a wide range of applications using IT. This includes both the research and professional world as well as private everyday life.

The Bachelor's programme in Information Systems at the renowned WiSo Faculty and the Cologne Institute for Information Systems offers a broad basic education in the interplay of theory and practice at the interface of economics and computer science. You will be given the opportunity to put analytical structuring, thinking and acting into practice in research and application-oriented manner by using the knowledge and skills you have acquired to solve practical problems.

To top of page

Still undecided?

Then get to know ouroffers for prospective students, which are coordinated by the WiSo Student Service Point and will provide you with individual advice tailored precisely to your needs.

We receive applications from a large number of different nationalities for the majority of our degree programmes, so a large international and intercultural environment exists both at the faculty and within your degree programme. A large number of courses are therefore offered in English, depending on the specialisation.

The WiSo Faculty is a member of several networks of international universities, which assists you in spending a semester abroad at a renowned partner university. The programme is designed so that you can spend a semester abroad in your fourth or fifth semester.We are happy to adviseyou on your options and provide you with organisational support before, during and after your exchange.

With its balanced theoretical and practical approach, the degree programme prepares you for entry into internationally oriented professions and enables you to work in an international environment. Additionally, the WiSo Faculty has a broad alumni network of former students who work in all business sectors around the globe.

The international focus and outstanding reputation of the WiSo Faculty at the University of Cologne make it a premier destination for your studies in Germany – at the heart of Europe.

To top of page

B.Sc. Information Systems graduates possess the dual qualification of business management and computer science that is often sought after in the job market. As a graduate, you are eligible for employment in various sectors (e.g., business consulting, systems development management, and information management) and internal departments. You will function as an intermediary between business processes and the technically-anchored system world.

Successful completion of the degree programme offers you a springboard into the attractive (IT) job market through our existing wide-ranging network of top industry and business professionals. As a result, you will work in a variety of different roles across all sectors. The versatility of the possible degree applications can be seen in the potential job offerings, such as:

With a good Bachelor's degree and an appropriate focus, the programme also prepares you for further academic education and a scientific career. Potential areas of further study are theM.Sc. Information Systemsas well as theM.Sc. Business Analytics and Econometricsat the University of Cologne or similar programmes in business informatics, information systems, business analytics or data science at other universities.

To top of page

By enrolling in the degree programme, you become part of a large network of current and former students, our alumni. This gives you exclusive access to the practical and business world during and after your studies. Multiple event series and special coaching programmes put you in contact with companies and other potential employers.

So that you can get an idea of student life at the WiSo Faculty,WiSo alumnifrom business, science and society report on their experiences during their studies as well as their professional careers and challenges.

Through my studies, I gained a broad insight into the field of information systems, expanded my professional and personal network and even got to know my co-founders.

To top of page

The application deadline for thefirst semesteris usually:

Applicants from Germany and EU countries apply online via the website of theStudent’s Registration Office.Applicants fromnon-EU countriesapply viauni-assist.

We are happy to support you in your ambitions:

If you are interested in or have questions about our WiSo degree programmes, the student advisors at theWiSo Student Service Pointwill be happy to help:

To top of page

To top of page

Paco, will answer all your fact-based questions about your desired degree programme at any time!*

[follow us!]

Ausgezeichnete Forschung hat an der Wirtschafts- und Sozialwissenschaftlichen Fakultät der Universität zu Köln oberste Priorität. Auf dieser Seite können Sie anhand der individuellen Forschungsprofile unserer Forscher:innen einen Einblick in die Vielfalt und Interdisziplinarität unserer Forschung gewinnen. Gerne stellen wir Ihnen alle Forscher:innen unserer Fakultät mit ihren jeweiligen akademischen sowie beruflichen Karrierewegen, Publikationen und weiteren Informationen sowie den Kontaktdaten vor.

Die Liste wird ständig erweitert und aktualisiert.

title: Die WiSo im UzK-Forschungsprofil - WiSo-Fakultät
content:
Vernetzte Forschung zu großen gesellschaftlichen Herausforderungen

320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxGestützt auf unseren interdisziplinären Forschungsansatz leisten die Wissenschaftler:innen der WiSo-Fakultät einen wesentlichen Beitrag zur wissenschaftlichen Exzellenz der Universität zu Köln, die zu den forschungsstärksten Hochschulen in Deutschland und Europa zählt und weltweit einen hervorragenden Ruf genießt.Die enge fakultätsübergreifende Zusammenarbeit im Rahmen des breit gefächerten Studien- und Forschungsangebots der Universität ermöglicht es, dabei die großen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit auf internationalem Spitzenniveau anzugehen. Einrichtungen wie das Kölner Laboratorium für Wirtschaftsforschung (CLER) stärken zusätzlich die exzellente Forschungsinfrastruktur der Universität zu Köln.Projekte, Initiativen und Research Center mit maßgeblicher WiSo-BeteiligungResearch Center C-SEB320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxDas Zentrum für Soziales und Ökonomisches Verhalten (C-SEB) wurde Anfang 2015 gegründet. Das Research Center repräsentiert und managt denhttps://www.uni-koeln.de/forschung/forschungsprofil/kernprofilbereicheKernprofilbereich (Key Profile Area, KPA) "Social and Economic Behavior" der Universität zu Köln und entwickelt ihn weiter. Die KP führt Forscher:innen aus der Volkswirtschaftslehre, der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, der Psychologie und verwandten Bereichen zusammen, um soziales und ökonomisches Verhalten zu erforschen.Exzellenzcluster ECONtribute: Märkte und Public Policy320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxECONtribute: Märkte & Public Policy, der deutschlandweit erste Exzellenzcluster in den Wirtschaftswissenschaften, wird seit dem Jahr 2019 gemeinsam von der Universität Bonn und der Universität zu Köln getragen. Ziel des Clusters ist es, ein neues Paradigma für die Analyse von Märkten und öffentlicher Ordnung im Hinblick auf grundlegende gesellschaftliche und technologische Herausforderungen voranzutreiben. Alle Forschungsaktivitäten werden unter dem Dach des Reinhard Selten Insituts (RSI) koordiniert. Die Forschungsergebnisse des Clusters zielen unmittelbar darauf ab, relevanten Akteuren Mittel an die Hand zu geben, auf die Herausforderungen unserer Zeit evidenzbasiert zu reagieren.Kernprofilbereich Social and Economic BehaviorIm Zusammenspiel der neun Kernprofilbereiche der Universität zu Köln ist es eine zentrale Aufgabe des Kernprofilbereichs Sovial and Economic Behior verschiedene Forschungsansätze zusammenzuführen und auf dieser Grundlage zu verstehen, wie Erkenntnisse aus der Verhaltensforschung in der Praxis zur Lösung der großen gesellschaftlichen und wirtschaftlichen Herausforderungengenutzt werden können.Innerhalb des Kernprofilbereichs wird seit 2019 derExzellenzcluster ECONtribute: Märkte & Public Policyin Zusammenarbeit mit der Universität Bonn im Rahmen derExzellenzstrategie des Bundes und der Länder (ExStra)gefördert.• ausführliche Informationen zum Forschungsprofil der Universität zu Köln →Social-Media-Kanäle der WiSo-Fakultät[follow us!]HIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum Chatzum Seitenanfang

Gestützt auf unseren interdisziplinären Forschungsansatz leisten die Wissenschaftler:innen der WiSo-Fakultät einen wesentlichen Beitrag zur wissenschaftlichen Exzellenz der Universität zu Köln, die zu den forschungsstärksten Hochschulen in Deutschland und Europa zählt und weltweit einen hervorragenden Ruf genießt.

Die enge fakultätsübergreifende Zusammenarbeit im Rahmen des breit gefächerten Studien- und Forschungsangebots der Universität ermöglicht es, dabei die großen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit auf internationalem Spitzenniveau anzugehen. Einrichtungen wie das Kölner Laboratorium für Wirtschaftsforschung (CLER) stärken zusätzlich die exzellente Forschungsinfrastruktur der Universität zu Köln.

Das Zentrum für Soziales und Ökonomisches Verhalten (C-SEB) wurde Anfang 2015 gegründet. Das Research Center repräsentiert und managt denhttps://www.uni-koeln.de/forschung/forschungsprofil/kernprofilbereicheKernprofilbereich (Key Profile Area, KPA) "Social and Economic Behavior" der Universität zu Köln und entwickelt ihn weiter. Die KP führt Forscher:innen aus der Volkswirtschaftslehre, der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, der Psychologie und verwandten Bereichen zusammen, um soziales und ökonomisches Verhalten zu erforschen.

ECONtribute: Märkte & Public Policy, der deutschlandweit erste Exzellenzcluster in den Wirtschaftswissenschaften, wird seit dem Jahr 2019 gemeinsam von der Universität Bonn und der Universität zu Köln getragen. Ziel des Clusters ist es, ein neues Paradigma für die Analyse von Märkten und öffentlicher Ordnung im Hinblick auf grundlegende gesellschaftliche und technologische Herausforderungen voranzutreiben. Alle Forschungsaktivitäten werden unter dem Dach des Reinhard Selten Insituts (RSI) koordiniert. Die Forschungsergebnisse des Clusters zielen unmittelbar darauf ab, relevanten Akteuren Mittel an die Hand zu geben, auf die Herausforderungen unserer Zeit evidenzbasiert zu reagieren.

Im Zusammenspiel der neun Kernprofilbereiche der Universität zu Köln ist es eine zentrale Aufgabe des Kernprofilbereichs Sovial and Economic Behior verschiedene Forschungsansätze zusammenzuführen und auf dieser Grundlage zu verstehen, wie Erkenntnisse aus der Verhaltensforschung in der Praxis zur Lösung der großen gesellschaftlichen und wirtschaftlichen Herausforderungengenutzt werden können.

Innerhalb des Kernprofilbereichs wird seit 2019 derExzellenzcluster ECONtribute: Märkte & Public Policyin Zusammenarbeit mit der Universität Bonn im Rahmen derExzellenzstrategie des Bundes und der Länder (ExStra)gefördert.

title: Business Administration Researcher Ranking - WiSo Faculty
content:
Business Administration Research RankingThe Business Administration Research Ranking of the "WirtschaftsWoche" lists the publications of business economists working at chairs, Fraunhofer and Max Planck Institutes in Germany, Austria and Switzerland (including post-docs and junior professors).The ranking of current research performance includes publications in the five-year period 2020 to 2024 inclusive. The lifetime performance ranking takes into account all articles ever published by a researcher, the ranking of young researchers all publications by researchers who were not yet 40 years old on the cut-off date.The ranking is published every two years, in even numbered year. The cut-off date is 1. August 2024.In the ranking "The Top Researchers in Business Administration from Germany, Austria and Switzerland 2024",WiSo-Prof. Wolfgang Ketteris ranked 13th. In addition,Prof. Dirk Sliwka(73rd) andProf. Ulrich Thonemann, (81st) are among the top 100.In the ranking "The most research-intensive business economists under 40 in 2024",Prof. Anne Burmeister(69th) is listed among the top 75.In "The Great Lifetime Achievement Ranking 2024",Prof. Ulrich Thonemannis in 35thplace. In addition,Prof. Dirk Sliwka,Prof. Werner Reinartz,Prof. Wolfgang Ketter, andProf. Christoph Rosenkranzare among the top 100.Prof. Detlef Schoder,Prof. Franziska Völckner,Prof. Alexander Kempf,Prof. Marc FischerandProf. Bernd Irlenbuschare among the top 200.In the WirtschaftsWoche Faculty Ranking 2024 the University of Cologne is ranked 4thplace in the German speaking countries Germany, Austria and Switzerland and 2ndplace in Germany.HIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum ChatTo top of page

The Business Administration Research Ranking of the "WirtschaftsWoche" lists the publications of business economists working at chairs, Fraunhofer and Max Planck Institutes in Germany, Austria and Switzerland (including post-docs and junior professors).

The ranking of current research performance includes publications in the five-year period 2020 to 2024 inclusive. The lifetime performance ranking takes into account all articles ever published by a researcher, the ranking of young researchers all publications by researchers who were not yet 40 years old on the cut-off date.The ranking is published every two years, in even numbered year. The cut-off date is 1. August 2024.

In the ranking "The Top Researchers in Business Administration from Germany, Austria and Switzerland 2024",WiSo-Prof. Wolfgang Ketteris ranked 13th. In addition,Prof. Dirk Sliwka(73rd) andProf. Ulrich Thonemann, (81st) are among the top 100.

In the ranking "The most research-intensive business economists under 40 in 2024",Prof. Anne Burmeister(69th) is listed among the top 75.

In "The Great Lifetime Achievement Ranking 2024",Prof. Ulrich Thonemannis in 35thplace. In addition,Prof. Dirk Sliwka,Prof. Werner Reinartz,Prof. Wolfgang Ketter, andProf. Christoph Rosenkranzare among the top 100.Prof. Detlef Schoder,Prof. Franziska Völckner,Prof. Alexander Kempf,Prof. Marc FischerandProf. Bernd Irlenbuschare among the top 200.

In the WirtschaftsWoche Faculty Ranking 2024 the University of Cologne is ranked 4thplace in the German speaking countries Germany, Austria and Switzerland and 2ndplace in Germany.

title: Kindertagesstätte Paramecium
content:
Bitte aktivieren Sie Javascript in Ihrem Browser!

TopthemenArtikel1Artikel2auf einen Blick:Informationen für ElternForschung & LehreEntdeckungs-Spielraum für Kinder - Forschungs-Freiraum für ElternHerzlich willkommen auf unserer Homepage. Schön, dass Sie sich für das Kinderhaus interessieren!Im Oktober 2011 öffnete die Kindertagesstätte der Universität zu KölnParameciumihre Türen. Auf unserer Homepage möchten wir Eltern und anderen Interessierten einen Einblick in die Kindertagesstätte und unsere pädagogische Arbeit geben.Gleichberechtigung und Vereinbarkeit von Familie und BerufDie KindertagesstätteParameciummöchte insbesondere die Gleichberechtigungschancen des weiblichen wissenschaftlichen Nachwuchses fördern und durch die Möglichkeit einer besseren Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf die Entscheidung für eine wissenschaftliche Karriere von Frauen unterstützen. Kinder von Habilitandinnen, JuniorProfessorinnen und Doktorandinnen werden in diesem Sinne bevorzugt aufgenommen. An universitäre Arbeitszeiten angepasste und durchgängige Öffnungszeiten, auch während der Schulferien, sowie ein arbeitsplatznaher Standort der Kindertagesstätte unterstützen dieses Vorhaben zudem.Raum für Entwicklung und Forschergeist"Das Kind ist ein Forscher. Es stellt sich Problemen und löst sie. Es ist fähig, selbst zu lernen." (Loris Malaguzzi)Wir möchten eine anregende und fördernde Lern- und Lebenswelt für Kinder ab vier Monaten schaffen und sehen die Kita als Ort frühkindlicher Bildungsprozesse und kindlicher Lebenswelt. Es ist unser Ziel, der Vielseitigkeit und Individualität von kindlichen Bildungswegen  Wertschätzung und Anerkennung entgegen zu bringen. Dabei orientiert sich unsere pädagogische Arbeit an den Prinzipien der Reggio Pädagogik sowie der offenen Arbeit. Das Kind ist reich an Potenzialen und mit erkenntnissgewinnendem Blick erlebt und entdeckt es im sozialen Austausch seine Umwelt mit „100 Sprachen“.Unser Bild vom KindPädagogisches KonzeptBegegnung, Bewegung, EntfaltungRäume im KinderhausAuf einen BlickInformationen für ElternZusammenarbeit mitForschung & LehreFörderung & SponsoringDer Förderverein

auf einen Blick:Informationen für Eltern

Forschung & Lehre

Im Oktober 2011 öffnete die Kindertagesstätte der Universität zu KölnParameciumihre Türen. Auf unserer Homepage möchten wir Eltern und anderen Interessierten einen Einblick in die Kindertagesstätte und unsere pädagogische Arbeit geben.

Die KindertagesstätteParameciummöchte insbesondere die Gleichberechtigungschancen des weiblichen wissenschaftlichen Nachwuchses fördern und durch die Möglichkeit einer besseren Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf die Entscheidung für eine wissenschaftliche Karriere von Frauen unterstützen. Kinder von Habilitandinnen, JuniorProfessorinnen und Doktorandinnen werden in diesem Sinne bevorzugt aufgenommen. An universitäre Arbeitszeiten angepasste und durchgängige Öffnungszeiten, auch während der Schulferien, sowie ein arbeitsplatznaher Standort der Kindertagesstätte unterstützen dieses Vorhaben zudem.

Wir möchten eine anregende und fördernde Lern- und Lebenswelt für Kinder ab vier Monaten schaffen und sehen die Kita als Ort frühkindlicher Bildungsprozesse und kindlicher Lebenswelt. Es ist unser Ziel, der Vielseitigkeit und Individualität von kindlichen Bildungswegen  Wertschätzung und Anerkennung entgegen zu bringen. Dabei orientiert sich unsere pädagogische Arbeit an den Prinzipien der Reggio Pädagogik sowie der offenen Arbeit. Das Kind ist reich an Potenzialen und mit erkenntnissgewinnendem Blick erlebt und entdeckt es im sozialen Austausch seine Umwelt mit „100 Sprachen“.

title: Double Master's Programme in Economics
content:
International study programmeDouble Master's Programme in Economicsin cooperation with Keio University in Tokyo320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxKey facts320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxPartner:Keio University in Tokyo, JapanProgramme structure:First year at the University of Cologne, second year at Keio UniversityDegrees:Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Economics from the University of CologneMaster of Arts (M.A.) in Economics from Keio UniversityDuration:4 semestersStart:Fall term (October in Cologne)Language:EnglishMaster's Virtual Open Day320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxPlease REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.ProgrammeDevelop a better understanding of economic and social issues, such as the design and regulation of markets, individual behavior, public and monetary policy and taxationGain exposure to a variety of theoretical approachesReceive state-of-the-art training in quantitative and qualitative research methods and data analysis toolsLearn how to apply these methods and tools to independently analyse and develop conceptual models to predict responses to changes in policy and market conditionsDevelop ideas on how to solve complex economic problems in a globalised, interconnected world by considering cross-national linkages and implicationsBenefit from the expertise of two leading universities. Upon successful completion of your studies, you will be awarded both master’s degrees: aMaster of Science in Economicsfrom the University of Cologne and aMaster of Arts in Economicsfrom Keio University.320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440px"It is a huge privilege to study at these great institutions. The opportunity to gain such diverse experiences and make friends from all over the globe is unique and enriches my understanding of the world. I am certain that these skills will help me to become a better economist. The programme is ideal for students who want more than just a degree in economics."Valentin Edert, Student of the programmePartner: Keio UniversityKeio Universityis a leading university committed to excellence and innovation in education and research. It is located in central Tokyo. The mission of theFaculty of Economicsat Keio University is to provide its graduate students with the highest level of economic knowledge and skills to solve real-world problems, and to develop talented individuals with advanced professional skills, whether they pursue research or careers in business.320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxCoursesThe courses offered by the two universities cover a wide range of topics and complement each other very well. The double degree is integrated into the regular master's programmes. It includes courses from both universities and is based on credit transfer.320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxYou will study the courses marked in dark green and dark blue. By means of credit transfer, you will be able to transfer the credits that you do not study at the University of Cologne to Keio University and vice versa (marked in light green or light blue).As part of the programme, you will write a Master's thesis in your second year.Courses at the University of CologneDuring your first year of studies at the University of Cologne, you will study 60 ECTS credits. Please consult thecourse cataloguefor further details.Core section (24 ECTS)You will acquire methodological skills that will enable you to independently analyse economic problems on a theoretical and empirical level. The core section consists of four courses: Mathematics, Microeconomics, Macroeconomics and Econometrics (6 ECTS each).Specialisation section (30 ECTS)You will be able to choose a group on which you would like to focus:Empirical Methods & Data Analysis: Focus on empirical analysis tools (Statistics & Econometrics)Markets & Economic Policy: Focus on public policy issues and the functioning of markets from a macroeconomic perspective (Growth Labour and Inequality in the Global Economy,Macroeconomics and Public Economics,Macroeconomics, Money and Financial Markets,Markets & Institutions)Market Design & Behaviour: Focus on the microeconomic workings of specific markets and how they should be regulated, and the behavior of individuals within those markets (Design & Behaviour)Energy and Climate ChangeEach group consists of a methods course, a seminar and three electives.Supplementary section (6 ECTS)One seminar in Economics. You can choose a seminar from a range of offers. This gives you the opportunity to specialise further within your chosen group of your specialisation section, or to diversify your studies by choosing a seminar from another group.You will study the remaining credits of the supplementary section at Keio University.Courses at Keio UniversityAt Keio University, you will study 20 Keio credits (10 courses worth 2 Keio credits each). You can choose courses as follows:at least 4 Keio credits of specialised coursesat least 4 Keio credits of seminars12 Keio credits in general courses, specialised courses or seminarsTo get an impression of the courses offered at Keio University, please consult theKeio course catalogue(switch to English and then search for Faculty/Graduate School: [Master's] Economics).Career opportunitiesGraduates of the Double Master's Programme in Economics will be well prepared for careers with an international focus. Possible roles include:positions in public institutions such as ministries, government departments, central banks, agencies and public authorities (such as antitrust divisions or regulatory authorities) or international institutions (such as the OECD, IMF, World Bank or the European Commission);economic advisor in a government ministry or economic advisor to a political party;researcher in an academic or research institution;positions in economic departments of private institutions such as banks, consultancies, large industrial corporations, organisations or companies in the media sector;analyst in a financial institution or manager in an investment bank;in-house economic journalist.Application320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxFind out about theentry requirements and how to apply for the programme.ContactWould you like to know more about the programme? Get in touch with the Programme Manager:Xenia ElbrächterProgramme ManagerPhone: +49 (0)221 470-7702Email:Contact formHIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum Chatzum Seitenanfang

in cooperation with Keio University in Tokyo

Please REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.

Please REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.

Benefit from the expertise of two leading universities. Upon successful completion of your studies, you will be awarded both master’s degrees: aMaster of Science in Economicsfrom the University of Cologne and aMaster of Arts in Economicsfrom Keio University.

Valentin Edert, Student of the programme

Keio Universityis a leading university committed to excellence and innovation in education and research. It is located in central Tokyo. The mission of theFaculty of Economicsat Keio University is to provide its graduate students with the highest level of economic knowledge and skills to solve real-world problems, and to develop talented individuals with advanced professional skills, whether they pursue research or careers in business.

The courses offered by the two universities cover a wide range of topics and complement each other very well. The double degree is integrated into the regular master's programmes. It includes courses from both universities and is based on credit transfer.

You will study the courses marked in dark green and dark blue. By means of credit transfer, you will be able to transfer the credits that you do not study at the University of Cologne to Keio University and vice versa (marked in light green or light blue).

As part of the programme, you will write a Master's thesis in your second year.

During your first year of studies at the University of Cologne, you will study 60 ECTS credits. Please consult thecourse cataloguefor further details.

Core section (24 ECTS)

You will acquire methodological skills that will enable you to independently analyse economic problems on a theoretical and empirical level. The core section consists of four courses: Mathematics, Microeconomics, Macroeconomics and Econometrics (6 ECTS each).

Specialisation section (30 ECTS)

You will be able to choose a group on which you would like to focus:

Each group consists of a methods course, a seminar and three electives.

Supplementary section (6 ECTS)

One seminar in Economics. You can choose a seminar from a range of offers. This gives you the opportunity to specialise further within your chosen group of your specialisation section, or to diversify your studies by choosing a seminar from another group.

You will study the remaining credits of the supplementary section at Keio University.

At Keio University, you will study 20 Keio credits (10 courses worth 2 Keio credits each). You can choose courses as follows:

To get an impression of the courses offered at Keio University, please consult theKeio course catalogue(switch to English and then search for Faculty/Graduate School: [Master's] Economics).

Graduates of the Double Master's Programme in Economics will be well prepared for careers with an international focus. Possible roles include:

Find out about theentry requirements and how to apply for the programme.

Would you like to know more about the programme? Get in touch with the Programme Manager:

Xenia ElbrächterProgramme Manager

title: Financial Times - WiSo-Fakultät
content:
Financial TimesDas Ranking bewertet weltweit die besten Business Schools und MBA-Programme. Daran sind über 100 Universitäten beteiligt, die strenge Aufnahmekriterien erfüllen müssen. Alle Universitäten sind international akkreditiert und ihre Programme werden seit mindestens vier Jahren angeboten und werden von mindestens 30 Absolvent:innen pro Jahr abgeschlossen. Die Rangliste wird anhand mehrerer Kriterien erstellt. Zum einen wird die Universität anhand einer Befragung der Absolvent:innen bewertet, die ihren Master in Vollzeit absolvieren. 20 Prozent der Absolvent:innen oder mindestens 20 Personen müssen an der FT-Umfrage teilnehmen. Die Absolvent:innenumfrage hat bei der Erstellung der Rangliste mit bis zu 56 Prozent die höchste Gewichtung. Weitere für die Bewertung relevante Daten sind die Vielfalt der Mitarbeiter:innen, Vorstandsmitglieder und Student:innen nach Geschlecht und Nationalität, der Anteil der Unterrichtsstunden, die sich mit Umwelt-, Sozial- und Governance-Themen sowie Klimaproblemlösungen befassen und die Reduktion des CO2 Fußabdrucks.Financial Times Ranking „Masters in Management" 2025Die WiSo-Fakultät erreicht mit dem Master International Management (CEMS MIM) im weltweiten VergleichRang 37, nationalRang 4und gehört damit zu den Top-Management-Ausbildungen in Deutschland (Weblink).Im Bereich "International Opportunities", der den „International course experience rank“ umfasst, erreicht die WiSoPlatz 1in Deutschland (weltweit Rang 12). Dieser Indikator berücksichtigt, wie viele Absolvent:innen Auslandsaufenthalte und Praktika absolviert haben.Financial Times Ranking „European Business Schools" 2024ImFinancial Times European Business Schools 2024 Rankingerreicht die WiSo-Fakultät den65. Rangvon 100 im internationalen Vergleich. Im nationalen Vergleich bedeutet diesPlatz 7in Deutschland.HIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum Chatzum Seitenanfang

Das Ranking bewertet weltweit die besten Business Schools und MBA-Programme. Daran sind über 100 Universitäten beteiligt, die strenge Aufnahmekriterien erfüllen müssen. Alle Universitäten sind international akkreditiert und ihre Programme werden seit mindestens vier Jahren angeboten und werden von mindestens 30 Absolvent:innen pro Jahr abgeschlossen. Die Rangliste wird anhand mehrerer Kriterien erstellt. Zum einen wird die Universität anhand einer Befragung der Absolvent:innen bewertet, die ihren Master in Vollzeit absolvieren. 20 Prozent der Absolvent:innen oder mindestens 20 Personen müssen an der FT-Umfrage teilnehmen. Die Absolvent:innenumfrage hat bei der Erstellung der Rangliste mit bis zu 56 Prozent die höchste Gewichtung. Weitere für die Bewertung relevante Daten sind die Vielfalt der Mitarbeiter:innen, Vorstandsmitglieder und Student:innen nach Geschlecht und Nationalität, der Anteil der Unterrichtsstunden, die sich mit Umwelt-, Sozial- und Governance-Themen sowie Klimaproblemlösungen befassen und die Reduktion des CO2 Fußabdrucks.

Die WiSo-Fakultät erreicht mit dem Master International Management (CEMS MIM) im weltweiten VergleichRang 37, nationalRang 4und gehört damit zu den Top-Management-Ausbildungen in Deutschland (Weblink).Im Bereich "International Opportunities", der den „International course experience rank“ umfasst, erreicht die WiSoPlatz 1in Deutschland (weltweit Rang 12). Dieser Indikator berücksichtigt, wie viele Absolvent:innen Auslandsaufenthalte und Praktika absolviert haben.

ImFinancial Times European Business Schools 2024 Rankingerreicht die WiSo-Fakultät den65. Rangvon 100 im internationalen Vergleich. Im nationalen Vergleich bedeutet diesPlatz 7in Deutschland.

If you want to know what it's actually like to study at Faculty of Management, Economics and Social Sciences or if you want to find out first-hand what is important in your desired degree programme, we have the right offers for you here. Also if you are not sure yet or  want to find out whether your study decision really suits you, you have come to the right place.

Are you interested in studying at the WiSo Faculty and looking for quick information about courses, admission procedures or general questions about the University of Cologne? ThenPacois just right for you! Paco, the artificial intelligence of the WiSo Faculty of the University of Cologne, will answer all your fact-based questions about your desired degree programme at any time - without waiting.

Just give it a try!*

Pacois the perfect complement to'Chat with a Student'. While Paco provides you with quick and reliable facts, 'Chat with a Student' gives you an authentic insight into studying: real WiSo students tell you first-hand about their experiences of everyday life at university and their degree programmes.

Do you want first-hand insights and experiences about the Study Programmes of the WiSo Faculty and the Student life at the University of Cologne from WiSo students?

Then don't hesitate and Chat with a student!

WithPacoand„Chat with a Student“, you have everything you need to optimally prepare for your choice of degree programme!

Do you want to find out which degree course is right for you?Discover it withPaco Fitting!

By answering just eight questions about your interests and abilities, you’ll gain a clear idea and receive your personal ranking of degree courses. With extensive comparison options, you’re sure to make the best decision for your future!

Find your match!

Our experts are at numerous trade fairs and events. Let's talk and answer all your questions. We look forward to getting to know you and helping you!

Please REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.

Please REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.

The annual Open House of the University of Cologne will take place on8th November 2025. On this day, prospective students can gain an insight into studying at the University of Cologne. All faculties and institutions will be represented with a colourful programme.

In the main building of the University of Cologne, you will find our sample lectures in the study programmes of the WiSo Faculty as well as an information event on the subject of semesters abroad.

Come by and take a look at the University of Cologne and the study programmes offered by the WiSo Faculty.

You can find more information on thewebsite(only available in German) of the Central Student Advisory Service of the University of Cologne.

Are you interested in a studyprogramme of the Faculty of Management, Economics and Social Sciences of the University of Cologne? Then get to know our degree programs at our information event. Find out everything about our academic programmes and discover the diverse job opportunities available after graduation.

We will publish the dates for the upcoming October sessions in September. Stay tuned for more details.

With the help of an online self-assessment (OSA)*, you can find out whether your personal interests, expectations and competences match the requirements and contents of the degree programmes at the Faculty of Management, Economics and Social Sciences.

For the B.Sc. in Economics, prior completion of the OSA is a prerequisite for enrolment.

In addition, it contains further information and counselling services that can support you on the way to your study decision.

*Registration in the UzK Assessment-ILIAS is required.

OSA Economics (B.Sc.) (only available in German)

OSA Management, Economics & Social Sciences (B.Sc.)

The“Studieren Probieren”programme, offered by the Central Student Advisory Service at the University of Cologne, gives prospective students the chance to gain first-hand insight into everyday university life in selected degree programmes during term time.

As part of Studieren Probieren, the WiSo Faculty invites prospective students to attend tutorials, seminars and lectures in the following subjects: Business Administration, Economics, Social Sciences, Information Systems, Management, and Economics and Social Sciences. Additional opportunities are also available within the Teacher Training programme for Vocational Colleges and through public lecture series.

Detailed information about the taster programme run by the WiSo Faculty and other faculties, as well as how to register, can be found on the dedicated “Studieren Probieren” website.

For a comprehensive overview of the wide range of services offered by the Central Student Advisory Service, please visit:https://verwaltung.uni-koeln.de/abteilung21/content/index_ger.html

title: Master Economic Research
content:
Your next step to your academic career

320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxTable of ContentKey FactsWhat is special about our programme?Work in an international environmentBenefit from local networksCourse programme in M.Sc.What comes next?2. Stage: Dissertation Phase (PhD Economics)Chat with a studentKey Facts320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxDegree:Master of ScienceDuration:4 semesters, full-timeCredits:120 ECTSLanguage:EnglishContent:The programme combines canonical PhD level training in microeconomics, macroeconomics and econometrics with the possibility to focus on key research areas and methods in Economics at the University of CologneStart:Fall termApplication deadline:31stMarchMaster's Virtual Open Day320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxPlease REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.TheCologne Graduate School in Management, Economics and Social Sciencesof the WiSo-Faculty offers an exclusive two-stage graduate programme in Economic Research. We invite highly ambitious candidates with a particular interest in conducting academic research to apply for our programme. It includes a two-year-Master 's programme in Economic Research which is part of an integrated graduate programme ("PhD programme in Economics").320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxIn a small exclusive group of students, you will pass the first stage of the programme and receive a M.Sc. in Economics. You will benefit from a unique combination of excellent research with core topics in the field of economic research and specialisations within a broad range of topics and disciplines of the WiSo Faculty which allow you to tailor your own study profile and make yourself a specialist. You will focus on theoretical principles, learn about state-of-the-art research and use methods to do your own innovative economic research.The research focus of the M.Sc. prepares you for an academic career and enables you to pursue a PhD in the second stage of the programme. If you decide not to enter the second PhD stage of the programme, you are highly qualified for top positions in leading institutions and companies with advanced analytical focus with your M.Sc.What is special about our programme?The programme combines canonical PhD level training in microeconomics, macroeconomics and econometrics with the possibility to focus on key research areas and methods in Economics at the University of Cologne, like Behavioural Economics, Public Economics or advanced methods. Moreover, the programme offers the chance to include on selected topics from other M.Sc. programmes in Economics and related disciplines, like Management or Political Science.320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxFocus on research, not expensesThere are severalfunding options for our students to cover living expenseswhen pursuing their studies. This gives you the opportunity to fully concentrate on your studies instead of worrying about your expenses.320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxStill undecided?The Cologne Graduate School in Management, Economics and Social Sciences provides funding for a limited number of stipends during all or part of the programme.All applicants are considered for this funding; a separate application is not necessary.Orientation and counselling services for the PhD Programme in Economics of the Cologne Graduate School of the University of CologneAs the University of Cologne is state-funded, there are no institution fees - just a biannual "course and tuition fee". So you can invest in an excellent education - and your future - without paying a fortune.Work in an international environment320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxAll of our courses are offered in English. Complete your Master’s degree in English and prepare yourself for an international career. A large number of different nationalities apply for our Master's programmes. The faculty also cooperates with partner universities worldwide such that a term abroad can be integrated in your studies. We ensure you to study in an international as well as intercultural environment.More information and options.An international FacultyThe international focus and outstanding reputation of the WiSo Faculty at the University of Cologne make it a premier destination for your studies in Germany – at the heart of Europe.Calendar of Events for International StudentsInterested in a German course? Subject-specific and skills-based Language CoursesQuestions about visas, certificates, or jobs? The International Office is here to help!To top of pageBenefit from local research networksAll specialised courses of the programme relate to up-to-date research areas of our large research centres at the University of Cologne and Key Research Initiatives of the Faculty of Management, Economics and Social Sciences: TheCluster of Excellence ECONtribute: Markets & Public Policy,The Center for Social and Economic Behaviour (C-SEB)and theKey Research Initiative Behavioural Management Science (BMS).Become part of this network and explore research close at hand with renowned scientists. Research Master students are highly welcome to take part in lectures, seminars, workshops and events of our local expert networks. We further offer workspaces and IT facilities at the research centres that are exclusively available for M.Sc. Economic Research students.The master programme Economic Research appealed to me because of its interesting questions and the possibility of pursuing a doctorate. The small study groups and the intensive contact with professors and fellow students enabled me to master many challenges and develop specific research interests. The program prepared me very well for my time as a PhD student in which I can now implement my own research projects.As a first step toward my PhD, the master of Economic Research was great in preparing me for my current research. Especially advantageous was its small course sizes and easy access to the professors. This facilitates learning specific subject knowledge, and developing research ideas.
Additionally, having a dedicated office for the cohort and access to stipends and research assistant jobs at the faculty were additional reasons for choosing cologne. In my current PhD, I greatly profit from the excellent teaching of applied econometrics, and a broad knowledge of economic theory for instance in public economics.Course programme in M.Sc.The Master's programme contains 120 ECTS credits and comprises a core section, a specialisation and a Supplementary Section as well as a Master's Thesis.Thecore sectionof the master programme Economic Research contains 36 ECTS credit points. This area covers the advanced and research-oriented basis of micro- and macroeconomics, statistics, econometrics and mathematics. You are enabled to handle scientific literature of economic science and analyse economic problems on an advanced theoretical and empirical level.In thespecialisation section, you choose four specialisation courses in the research area you want to focus on in your proceeding studies. You can also broaden your general knowledge by choosing from core courses you did not attend in the core section before. Additionally, two Reading Groups in micro-, macroeconomics or econometrics are compulsory. Here, students read and discuss the latest research papers in the respective research area.Thesupplementary sectionserves as an additional section to further develop a more specific profile – either by deepening and specialising or by diversifying knowledge.Chat with a student320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxDo you want first-hand insights and experiences about the Master Economic Research and the Student life at the University of Cologne from WiSo students?Then don't hesitate and Chat with a student!What comes next?320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxAfter successful completion of stage 1 of the programme, you have two options:Continue with the second stage of the graduate programme and start your PhD straight away (dissertation phase).Finish the programme with the Master of Science in Economic Research and leave as a highly qualified candidate for top positions in leading institutions and companies.2. Stage: Dissertation Phase (PhD Economics)Key FactsStart: fall termYou have already completed the necessary PhD courses within our MSc programmeFind a supervisor and start with the three-year dissertation phase straight awayLanguage: EnglishDegree title: Philosophiae Doctor (PhD)Fees: Only social contribution fees (including ticket for public transport, seehere)Please find further information on the Webpages of the Cologne Graduate School in Management, Ecoomics and Social Sciences on thePhD Programme in Economics.If you are interested in or have questions about our WiSo degree programmes, the student advisors at theWiSo Student Service Pointwill be happy to help:WiSo Student Service Point hotline: +49 (0) 221/470-8818www.wiso-studentservice.uni-koeln.deHIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum ChatTo top of page

Please REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.

Please REGISTER HERE to join the Master’s Virtual Open Day.Take this opportunity to learn more about the WiSo Faculty, explore the study programmes and gain valuable insights from professors, current students and Alumni.

TheCologne Graduate School in Management, Economics and Social Sciencesof the WiSo-Faculty offers an exclusive two-stage graduate programme in Economic Research. We invite highly ambitious candidates with a particular interest in conducting academic research to apply for our programme. It includes a two-year-Master 's programme in Economic Research which is part of an integrated graduate programme ("PhD programme in Economics").

In a small exclusive group of students, you will pass the first stage of the programme and receive a M.Sc. in Economics. You will benefit from a unique combination of excellent research with core topics in the field of economic research and specialisations within a broad range of topics and disciplines of the WiSo Faculty which allow you to tailor your own study profile and make yourself a specialist. You will focus on theoretical principles, learn about state-of-the-art research and use methods to do your own innovative economic research.

The research focus of the M.Sc. prepares you for an academic career and enables you to pursue a PhD in the second stage of the programme. If you decide not to enter the second PhD stage of the programme, you are highly qualified for top positions in leading institutions and companies with advanced analytical focus with your M.Sc.

The programme combines canonical PhD level training in microeconomics, macroeconomics and econometrics with the possibility to focus on key research areas and methods in Economics at the University of Cologne, like Behavioural Economics, Public Economics or advanced methods. Moreover, the programme offers the chance to include on selected topics from other M.Sc. programmes in Economics and related disciplines, like Management or Political Science.

There are severalfunding options for our students to cover living expenseswhen pursuing their studies. This gives you the opportunity to fully concentrate on your studies instead of worrying about your expenses.

Still undecided?

The Cologne Graduate School in Management, Economics and Social Sciences provides funding for a limited number of stipends during all or part of the programme.All applicants are considered for this funding; a separate application is not necessary.

As the University of Cologne is state-funded, there are no institution fees - just a biannual "course and tuition fee". So you can invest in an excellent education - and your future - without paying a fortune.

All of our courses are offered in English. Complete your Master’s degree in English and prepare yourself for an international career. A large number of different nationalities apply for our Master's programmes. The faculty also cooperates with partner universities worldwide such that a term abroad can be integrated in your studies. We ensure you to study in an international as well as intercultural environment.More information and options.

The international focus and outstanding reputation of the WiSo Faculty at the University of Cologne make it a premier destination for your studies in Germany – at the heart of Europe.

To top of page

All specialised courses of the programme relate to up-to-date research areas of our large research centres at the University of Cologne and Key Research Initiatives of the Faculty of Management, Economics and Social Sciences: TheCluster of Excellence ECONtribute: Markets & Public Policy,The Center for Social and Economic Behaviour (C-SEB)and theKey Research Initiative Behavioural Management Science (BMS).

Become part of this network and explore research close at hand with renowned scientists. Research Master students are highly welcome to take part in lectures, seminars, workshops and events of our local expert networks. We further offer workspaces and IT facilities at the research centres that are exclusively available for M.Sc. Economic Research students.

The master programme Economic Research appealed to me because of its interesting questions and the possibility of pursuing a doctorate. The small study groups and the intensive contact with professors and fellow students enabled me to master many challenges and develop specific research interests. The program prepared me very well for my time as a PhD student in which I can now implement my own research projects.

As a first step toward my PhD, the master of Economic Research was great in preparing me for my current research. Especially advantageous was its small course sizes and easy access to the professors. This facilitates learning specific subject knowledge, and developing research ideas.
Additionally, having a dedicated office for the cohort and access to stipends and research assistant jobs at the faculty were additional reasons for choosing cologne. In my current PhD, I greatly profit from the excellent teaching of applied econometrics, and a broad knowledge of economic theory for instance in public economics.

The Master's programme contains 120 ECTS credits and comprises a core section, a specialisation and a Supplementary Section as well as a Master's Thesis.Thecore sectionof the master programme Economic Research contains 36 ECTS credit points. This area covers the advanced and research-oriented basis of micro- and macroeconomics, statistics, econometrics and mathematics. You are enabled to handle scientific literature of economic science and analyse economic problems on an advanced theoretical and empirical level.In thespecialisation section, you choose four specialisation courses in the research area you want to focus on in your proceeding studies. You can also broaden your general knowledge by choosing from core courses you did not attend in the core section before. Additionally, two Reading Groups in micro-, macroeconomics or econometrics are compulsory. Here, students read and discuss the latest research papers in the respective research area.Thesupplementary sectionserves as an additional section to further develop a more specific profile – either by deepening and specialising or by diversifying knowledge.

Do you want first-hand insights and experiences about the Master Economic Research and the Student life at the University of Cologne from WiSo students?Then don't hesitate and Chat with a student!

After successful completion of stage 1 of the programme, you have two options:

Continue with the second stage of the graduate programme and start your PhD straight away (dissertation phase).

Finish the programme with the Master of Science in Economic Research and leave as a highly qualified candidate for top positions in leading institutions and companies.

Please find further information on the Webpages of the Cologne Graduate School in Management, Ecoomics and Social Sciences on thePhD Programme in Economics.

If you are interested in or have questions about our WiSo degree programmes, the student advisors at theWiSo Student Service Pointwill be happy to help:

title: Academic Ranking of World Universities - WiSo-Fakultät
content:
Academic Ranking of World UniversitiesDas Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU- bzw. "Shanghai-Ranking") ist ein weltweites Hochschulranking, das seit 2003 erscheint und durch die "ShanghaiRanking Consultancy" veröffentlicht wird. Seit 2009 publiziert die ShanghaiRanking Consultancy außerdem das Global Ranking of Academic Subjects (GRAS).Insgesamt liegt die Universität zu Köln im aktuellenAcademic Ranking of World Universities2025 auf Platz 6-11 national und international in der Ranggruppe Platz 151-200.Global Ranking of Academic Subjects (GRAS)Mehr als 1900 Universitäten werden in fünf verschiedenen Fachrichtungen und in 55 Fächern gerankt. Je nach Fach werden jährlich zwischen 200 und 500 Universitäten im Ranking aufgeführt.Aktuelle Ergebnisse GRAS Ranking 2024:•"Soziologie" Platz 1. national, Platz 51-75 international•"Management" Platz 4. national (gemeinsam mit der Hochschule für Wirtschaft und Recht Berlin, der European School of Management and Technology (ESMT), dem Karlsruher Institut für Technologie (KIT), der Leuphana Universität Lüneburg, den Universitäten Leipzig, Mannheim und Münster, sowie der Universität München (LMU)), Platz 201-300 international•"Business Administration" Platz 4. national (gemeinsam mit der Freien Universität Berlin, der Technischen Universität München (TUM), der Universität Bayreuth, der Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU), der Universität Göttingen und der Universität Hamburg), Platz 201-300 international•"Political Sciences" Platz 9. national (gemeinsam mit der Universität Heidelberg, der Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, der Universität Osnabrück, der Universität Duisburg-Essen (UDE), sowie den Universitäten Erfurt und Mainz), Platz 151-200 international•"Economics" Platz 6. national (gemeinsam mit der Universität Bielefeld, der Freien Universität Berlin, der Technischen Universität München (TUM) und der Universität Mannheim), Platz 151-200 internationalIndikatoren und GewichtungDas GRAS setzt sich je nach Fach aus vier bis fünf Indikatoren zusammen. Gemessen und verglichen werden der Forschungsoutput (Q1), die Reichweite der Forschung, abgebildet durch Zitationen (CNCI), die internationale Zusammenarbeit (IC), die Qualität der Forschung (Anzahl der Publikationen in TOP Journals) und das Prestige der Forschenden, abgebildet durch erhaltene bedeutende Forschungspreise (TOP Awards).Q1Forschungsoutputgemessen an der Anzahl der Publikationen in TOP25% der Zeitschriften mit höchsten Impact FactorCNCICategory Normalized Citation ImpactReichweite der Forschung, gemessen an der Anzahl an erreichten Zitationen einer Publikation im Verhältnis zu der Anzahl an erreichten Zitationen, die eine Publikation desselben Publikationstyps und im selben Forschungsfeld und Veröffentlichungsjahr im Durchschnitt im Jahr erhältICInternational CooperationsInternationale Zusammenarbeiten, abgebildet durch den Anteil von Publikationen mit Ko-autorenschaften aus mindestens zwei LändernTOP JournalsQualität der Forschunggemessen an der Anzahl an Publikationen in TOP Journals (gewählt im Rahmen des Shanghai Ranking’s Academic Excellenz Survey)TOP AwardsPrestige der Forschendenabgebildet durch erhaltene bedeutende Forschungspreise (gewählt im Rahmen des Shanghai Ranking’s Academic Excellenz Survey). Der Indikator wird nur in den Fächern Economics (Alfred-Nobel-Gedächtnispreises für Wirtschaftswissenschaften), Statistik (Committee of Presidents of Statistical Societies (COPSS) Presidents' Award) und Politikwissenschaften (Johan Skytte Prize) verwendet.Gewichtung nach FachFachQ1CNCIICTOP JournalsTOP AwardsEconomics1505010100100Statistics1505010100100Political Sciences150501010020Sociology15050101000Communication15050101000Business Administration15050101000Finance15050101000Management15050101000Mehr dazu finden Sie auf der Website:Academic Ranking of World UniversitiesHIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum Chatzum Seitenanfang

Das Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU- bzw. "Shanghai-Ranking") ist ein weltweites Hochschulranking, das seit 2003 erscheint und durch die "ShanghaiRanking Consultancy" veröffentlicht wird. Seit 2009 publiziert die ShanghaiRanking Consultancy außerdem das Global Ranking of Academic Subjects (GRAS).

Insgesamt liegt die Universität zu Köln im aktuellenAcademic Ranking of World Universities2025 auf Platz 6-11 national und international in der Ranggruppe Platz 151-200.

Mehr als 1900 Universitäten werden in fünf verschiedenen Fachrichtungen und in 55 Fächern gerankt. Je nach Fach werden jährlich zwischen 200 und 500 Universitäten im Ranking aufgeführt.

Aktuelle Ergebnisse GRAS Ranking 2024:•"Soziologie" Platz 1. national, Platz 51-75 international•"Management" Platz 4. national (gemeinsam mit der Hochschule für Wirtschaft und Recht Berlin, der European School of Management and Technology (ESMT), dem Karlsruher Institut für Technologie (KIT), der Leuphana Universität Lüneburg, den Universitäten Leipzig, Mannheim und Münster, sowie der Universität München (LMU)), Platz 201-300 international•"Business Administration" Platz 4. national (gemeinsam mit der Freien Universität Berlin, der Technischen Universität München (TUM), der Universität Bayreuth, der Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU), der Universität Göttingen und der Universität Hamburg), Platz 201-300 international•"Political Sciences" Platz 9. national (gemeinsam mit der Universität Heidelberg, der Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, der Universität Osnabrück, der Universität Duisburg-Essen (UDE), sowie den Universitäten Erfurt und Mainz), Platz 151-200 international•"Economics" Platz 6. national (gemeinsam mit der Universität Bielefeld, der Freien Universität Berlin, der Technischen Universität München (TUM) und der Universität Mannheim), Platz 151-200 international

Das GRAS setzt sich je nach Fach aus vier bis fünf Indikatoren zusammen. Gemessen und verglichen werden der Forschungsoutput (Q1), die Reichweite der Forschung, abgebildet durch Zitationen (CNCI), die internationale Zusammenarbeit (IC), die Qualität der Forschung (Anzahl der Publikationen in TOP Journals) und das Prestige der Forschenden, abgebildet durch erhaltene bedeutende Forschungspreise (TOP Awards).

Forschungsoutputgemessen an der Anzahl der Publikationen in TOP25% der Zeitschriften mit höchsten Impact Factor

Category Normalized Citation ImpactReichweite der Forschung, gemessen an der Anzahl an erreichten Zitationen einer Publikation im Verhältnis zu der Anzahl an erreichten Zitationen, die eine Publikation desselben Publikationstyps und im selben Forschungsfeld und Veröffentlichungsjahr im Durchschnitt im Jahr erhält

International CooperationsInternationale Zusammenarbeiten, abgebildet durch den Anteil von Publikationen mit Ko-autorenschaften aus mindestens zwei Ländern

Qualität der Forschunggemessen an der Anzahl an Publikationen in TOP Journals (gewählt im Rahmen des Shanghai Ranking’s Academic Excellenz Survey)

Prestige der Forschendenabgebildet durch erhaltene bedeutende Forschungspreise (gewählt im Rahmen des Shanghai Ranking’s Academic Excellenz Survey). Der Indikator wird nur in den Fächern Economics (Alfred-Nobel-Gedächtnispreises für Wirtschaftswissenschaften), Statistik (Committee of Presidents of Statistical Societies (COPSS) Presidents' Award) und Politikwissenschaften (Johan Skytte Prize) verwendet.

title: IT - WiSo Faculty
content:
Herzlich willkommen!Die WiSo IT-Services sind für die Wirtschafts- und Sozialwissenschaftliche Fakultät der Universität zu Köln der zentrale Ansprechpartner für alle IT-Fragen. Wir bieten für die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter der Fakultät ein breites Angebot an IT-Infrastruktur, Dienstleistungen und Hilfestellung. Dabei arbeiten wir eng mit dem IT-Center der Universität zu Köln(RRZK)zusammen, das die universitätsweite IT-Infrastruktur bereitstellt.Wir begleiten und beraten Sie in allen IT-Belangen: Entweder helfen wir Ihnen direkt oder vermitteln Ihnen den nötigen Kontakt.320px480px640px786px1024px1280px1440pxHIStudiengang-ChatFrage direkt die KI zu Inhalten & BewerbungAsk a StudentFrag echte Studierende nach ihren ErfahrungenWiSo Student Service Point WiSSPoSchreibe uns deine konkreten FragenStudienwahl-AssistentFinde mit KI heraus, was zu dir passtBachelorMasterZum ChatTo top of page

Die WiSo IT-Services sind für die Wirtschafts- und Sozialwissenschaftliche Fakultät der Universität zu Köln der zentrale Ansprechpartner für alle IT-Fragen. Wir bieten für die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter der Fakultät ein breites Angebot an IT-Infrastruktur, Dienstleistungen und Hilfestellung. Dabei arbeiten wir eng mit dem IT-Center der Universität zu Köln(RRZK)zusammen, das die universitätsweite IT-Infrastruktur bereitstellt.

Wir begleiten und beraten Sie in allen IT-Belangen: Entweder helfen wir Ihnen direkt oder vermitteln Ihnen den nötigen Kontakt.

Advising Offer on International Options - Winter Semester 2025/26

The ZIB is offering a series of information events on international options at the WiSo Faculty. Seeherefor details on dates and registration.

Studying abroad gives students valuable experience in terms of their chosen field of study, cultural awareness and language learning. The Cologne WiSo Faculty offers its students numerous possibilities to gain international experience without having to extend their studies.

Students interested in an exchange term can apply for a single-term, tuition-free stay at one of the WiSo Faculty's partner universities through the Study Abroad ProgrammesSTAP BachelorandSTAP Master. Thefreemover programmeallows students to organise studies abroad themselves, irrespective of university exchange programmes.

Students who would prefer a shorter stay abroad can apply for theWiSo@NYC programme, a six-week summer programme in New York City or for theWiSo@London programme, a four-week short programme in London. There is also a choice of othersummer schools and short programmesas well as theUtrecht Short Programme in Sociologyfor sociology students.

Completing aninternship abroadis another great opportunity to gain valuable practical expertise, combined with a unique cultural experience.
